item.title: Maureen add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "One by one they were all becoming shades. Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age." -- James Joyce

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "She behaves as if she was beautiful. Most American women do. It is the secret of their charm." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maureen add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn't. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!" -- John Irving

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "Time's passage through the memory is like molten glass that can be opaque or crystalize at any given moment at will: a thousand days are melted into one conversation, one glance, one hurt, and one hurt can be shattered and sprinkled over a thousand days. It is silent and elusive, refusing to be damned and dripped out day by day; it swirls through the mind while an entire lifetime can ride like foam on the deceptive, transparent waves and get sprayed onto the conciousness at ragged, unexpected intervals. " -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Helen Fielding
item.description: "Tom has a theory that homosexuals and single women in their thirties have natural bonding: both being accustomed to disappointing their parents and being treated as freaks by society." -- Helen Fielding

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Maureen add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Then Scale by scale, We strip off The delicacy And eat The peaceful mush Of its green heart." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Maureen add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "Arriving at each new city, the traveler finds again a past of his that he did not know he had: the foreignness of what you no longer are or no longer possess lies in wait for you in foreign, unpossessed places." -- Italo Calvino
